Garth Brooks admits to lip-syncing at CMA Awards

Show Caption Hide Caption Garth Brooks says he lip-synced at the CMA Awards Garth Brooks says he lip-synced at the CMA Awards because he was sick.

Minutes after winning his second consecutive Entertainer of the Year award at the CMA Awards on Wednesday, Garth Brooks came clean.

More: 2017 CMA Awards: Garth Brooks wins Entertainer of the Year

More: Taylor Swift seems very surprised by her CMA Awards win

Speaking to reporters after the ceremony, Brooks acknowledged that he lip-synced his performance of "Ask Me How I Know" on Wednesday's show.

"We made a gametime call on whether to sing to a track or lip-sync," Brooks said. "And we decided to lip-sync it."

Brooks said he was sick, and in the midst of 12 shows in 10 days.

"We decided to lip-sync it because my voice was just not there, and we wanted to represent country music the best we can."

True to his Entertainer of the Year title, Brooks has been touring and performing relentlessly. He played five concerts last weekend: one on Friday, two on Saturday and two on Sunday.
